result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J. Abbott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.
Maintain employment. Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant  shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or by any other means with:  M.M., the victim in 14CM234.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend domestic violence programming and/or domestic violence court, if agent recommends.  

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J. Abbott

records.addlTxt:
Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Hirschman.  Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 2, in 15CM310. Remainint charges in 15CM310, plus 14CM234 and 15CM303 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Will be a joint recommendation for 1 year probation.  No alcohol or where sold or served.  AODA and recommended treatment. DV programming.  Maintain employment.  Any other treatment or counseling the agent recommends. Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  He understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Find guilty of misdemeanor bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a).  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Obtain and maintain employment.  DV programming and DV court if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  

Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.   AODA and recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Maintain employment. Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.  No contact with Mr. M, unless agent approves.  DV programming and DV court if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Lisa Hirschman

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  He applied for SPD representation today.  He qualifies.  STC set for 2/5 at 3 p.m.

This bond covers 3 cases 15CM310; 14CM234 and 15CM303:    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: M. M. and J. M.
